channel.title: Casbin Blog
channel.description: The best place to stay up-to-date with the latest Casbin news and events.

item.title: Authorization in APISIX using Casbin
item.description:
Introduction

APISIX is a high performance and scalable cloud native API gateway based on Nginx and etcd. It is an open source project by the Apache Software Foundation. Besides that, what makes APISIX so good is the support of many great built in plu...

item.title: Yang Luo - Google Open Source Peer Bonus Winner
item.description:
Today, we are pleased to announce that Casbin's founder, Yang Luo is awarded the "Google Open Source Peer Bonus winners" for his work on Casbin, Npcap and Nmap in 2019 Q3.

The original award letter can be accessed here.

The Google Open S...

item.title: Reworking our Documentation
item.description:
Today, we migrated Casbin's documentation from GitHub Wiki to Docs of this website, which is powered by Docusaurus. Docusaurus provides lots of awesome features like better Markdown styles, full-text search, versioning, translation.

The documentation...

item.title: node-Casbin: New Member of Casbin Family
item.description:
Today, we successfully ported Casbin to Node.js, which is named as: node-Casbin.

node-Casbin shares the similar usage and API with other implementations of Casbin. The middlewares for Express, Koa2 and Egg.js are ready to use. The storage adapter for...

item.title: Casbin Server is Launched!
item.description:
Some of our customers ask if Casbin can be used as a service instead of a library. The answer is YES. Today, we launched the Casbin Server project as a concrete solution for Access Control as a Service.

Casbin Server is under active development by ou...
